content: this text is about a divorce case being handled by a notary named master p the divorce is mutual consent meaning both parties agree to it mr u x and his wife ms k have provided detailed information about their personal and financial situation including assets debts and income they have agreed on the division of property and liabilities as well as arrangements for the custody and support of their children the agreement will take effect once filed with the court they have also waived certain rights and made provisions for residence costs and legal proceedings the divorce will become final once the decree is transcribed in the civil registers the parties need to provide their addresses for registration purposes the notary confirms the parties compliance with legal obligations and their right to seek legal counsel the necessary documents have been received and can be accessed electronically the original deed will be kept by the notary for at least 50 years the parties have signed the deed in the presence of the notary
